raw_text:
De Niro completes box office coup
 
 Robert De Niro has completed a transatlantic box office double by topping the UK and US film charts with two different films at the same time.
 
 Comedy sequel Meet the Fockers, in which he stars with Ben Stiller, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand, shot to the top of the UK chart at the weekend. It took £7.2m in three days - eight times more than the number two, Closer. Assault on Precinct 13 was in third. At the same time, US audiences were won over by his new thriller Hide and Seek. In Meet the Fockers, he picks up the role of an uptight father and ex-CIA agent from 2000 hit comedy, Meet the Parents.
 
 It is a big leap to his role in Hide and Seek, a supernatural horror in which he plays a widower whose daughter's imaginary friend turns nasty. In the UK box office chart, Meet the Fockers pushed Closer off the top spot while police action movie Assault On Precinct 13, starring rapper Ja Rule, made £750,000 in its first weekend. London Underground thriller Creep was another new entry at six while quirky comedy Sideways, which got five Oscar nominations last week, entered in eighth place. The Oscar nominations do not seem to have had an impact on fans' choices at cinemas. Leading contenders The Aviator, Million Dollar Baby and Ray all suffered substantial drops in takings compared with the previous weekend.
llama3.2:1b: Robert De Niro completes box office double by topping both UK and US film charts with two different films.
llama3.2:3b: Robert De Niro has completed a box office double by topping both the UK and US charts with his films Meet the Fockers and Hide and Seek respectively, with Meet the Fockers reaching £7.2m in its opening weekend and Hide and Seek performing well in its thriller debut.
gemma2:2b: Robert De Niro topped the UK and US box office charts simultaneously with two different movies: "Meet the Fockers" and "Hide and Seek." "Meet the Fockers" dominated the UK chart, pushing "Closer" off the top spot while "Hide and Seek," his thriller, achieved success in the US.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Robert De Niro's two box office hits that week: "Meet the Fockers" (UK: £7. 2m) and "Hide and Seek" (UK: £600,000), which took out the UK charts at the same time.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Robert De Niro tops UK box office charts with two films simultaneously: comedy sequel Meet the Fockers (£7.2m) and thriller Hide and Seek ($£750,000).
qwen2.5:3b: Robert De Niro's film 'Meet the Fockers' topped UK box office charts while his thriller 'Hide and Seek' did well in US. Both films feature De Niro alongside other stars like Ben Stiller, Dustin Hoffman, and Barbra Streisand. 'Assault on Precinct 13', starring rapper Ja Rule, also performed positively. Other notable entries include London's underground thriller 'Creep' and quirky comedy 'Sideways'. Previous top contenders such as 'The Aviator', 'Million Dollar Baby', and 'Ray' saw significant drops in box office numbers.
opencoder:1.5b:
De Niro completes a transatlantic box office double, earning both films at the same time on the UK and US film charts.

He completed Meet the Fockers in which he stars with Ben Stiller, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand. It was an intense action sequence where his role picked up from 2,000 hits in comedy, Meet the Parents. The film charted at the weekend earning it a spot near the top in both countries.

Closer was in third place on the UK chart more than twice as much box office as its second place US entry. The same time, Hide and Seek earned a spot in the top ten for the first time in American cinema during the previous week, while Assault On Precinct 13, starring Ja Rule, won £750,000 in its first weekend.

The Oscars have not had an impact on film choices at cinemas, as no contenders by Oscar categories were selected.
The Aviator, Million Dollar Baby and Ray all experienced substantial drops in box office compared to the previous weekend. Leading contender The Aviator also dropped near a million dollars from a similar entry last week. 
Overall, while the film charted high in both countries, it was not as influential on cinema choices as one might expect.

1. De Niro completes a transatlantic box office double by topping the UK and US film charts with two different films at the same time.
2. He stars in comedy sequel Meet the Fockers, which is shot to the top of the UK chart at the weekend. It takes £7.2m in three days - eight times more than the number two, Closer.
3. Assault on Precinct 13 was in third place on the US box office chart. De Niro's new thriller Hide and Seek is a big leap to his role in the film, which gets him into sixth place on the UK box office chart.
4. The Oscar nominations do not seem to have an impact on fans' choices at cinemas. Leading contenders The Aviator, Million Dollar Baby and Ray all suffered substantial drops in takings compared with the previous weekend.
